result.execSummary:
The defendant Lloyd Anthony King Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Pay all court costs and supervision fees. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay for the testing. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Defendant must live with father. Agent to approve any change of residence. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

timeConds.notes: To be completed during term of probation.

Defendant Lloyd Anthony King in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  Defendant is engaging in a program at Workforce Development to find employment and def. is graduating early from high school.  Defendant missed a meeting with his attorney.  Judge informs def. that meeting with his attorney is top priority.  
Parties are in the negotiation phase of the case.  No treatment is being sought.  This is not a Drug Court case.  Def. living with father currently.  New address and phone number is given to the court.  Def. to go to ZCI after court  Status conference scheduled for February 6, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Lloyd Anthony King in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.
  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Upon plea to charge w/o enhancer, the State agrees to follow PSI.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 12, 2014 at 08:15 am.
ZCI
Margaret Johnson
Preliminary hearing on November 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lloyd Anthony King in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Lloyd Anthony King in custody.  MacKenzie R. Bishop-Buchanan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 5, 2014 at 09:00 am.
